thread.section_title: Finance | Business and Finance News | News.com.au
thread.title: Sydney homes under the hammer this auction Saturday
thread.title_full: Sydney homes under the hammer this auction Saturday

author: Kirsten Craze and Brendan Wong
title: Sydney homes under the hammer this auction Saturday
text:
TODAY there were twice as many homes set to go under the hammer than the same weekend last year. So why the pre-spring rush?
On the same August weekend last year, when the Saturday fell on the 9th of the month there were 357 auctions scheduled.
This year on August 8 there were 839 homes set to auction and whether it is the auspicious 8/8 date, or another cyclic phenomenon, industry insiders all agree that the volume spike is unusual.
Greg Howard of Black Diamondz Property Concierge said that despite getting a solid result of $3.55 million for his latest sale in Lindfield, the property tide could be turning in Sydney.
“I’ve noticed a definite cooling off in recent weeks,” he said.
Mr Howard said that the large number of listings before the traditional spring market surge could be a case of nervous vendors
“I think it’s a case of people worrying a storm is coming and they want to sell now and get the best price,” he said.
Lindfield Sold: 22 Slade Ave, Lindfield sold at auction for $3.55 million. Source: Supplied
Where: 22 Slade Ave
What: A five-bedroom house
How much: $3.55 million
Suburb median: $1.9 million
Agent: Greg Howard, Black Diamondz Property Concierge
There were eight registered bidders keen to secure the modern home at 22 Slade St in s Lindfield.
The family-friendly property has spacious indoor/outdoor living spaces and a large swimming pool with an undercover cabana.
There is also a fully equipped home cinema, a double garage, full security and a main bedroom suite with an ensuite.
It is close to the Seven Little Australians Park nature reserve, Newington College and sits in the Lindfield Public School and Killara High School catchment areas.
Maroubra Sold: 3/3 Bona Vista Ave, Maroubra fetched $1.1 million. Source: Supplied
Where: 3/30 Bona Vista Ave
What: A two-bedroom apartment
How much: $1.1 million
Suburb median: $729,500 (units)
Agent: Shane Vincent, Belle Property
A keen buyer has swooped in an paid a huge $1.1 million for a two-bedroom unit in Maroubra with million-dollar views. A total of eight registered bidders pushed the sought-after unit’s purchase price to $110,000 more than the expected reserve price.
The simple unit, which has been refurbished is on the top floor of a block of nine. It features a
combined open lounge room and dining area, a wraparound balcony, built-in wardrobes, a CaesarStone kitchen and a bathroom with heated floors.
It is close to CBD transport, Maroubra Beach and Mahon Pool.
Guildford Sold: 182 Excelsior St, Guildford achieved $980,000 under the hammer. Source: Supplied
Where: 182 Excelsior St
What: A four-bedroom cladded house
How much: $980,000
Suburb median: $690,000
Agent: Ramin Rahimi, Starr Partners Merrylands
At the outset of the auction campaign, the humble cladded home had a price guide of “$740,000 plus” but on auction day the 698sq m property with a 15m frontage proved popular with buyers.
In addition to the four-bedroom family home, there is also a separate self-contained studio with a kitchenette and bathroom on site.
The house has air-conditioned lounge and dining rooms, a large gas kitchen with an island bench, ceiling fans and a main bedroom ensuite and out the back there is also a separate shed and workshop space.
Leichhardt
Sold: 35 Elswick St, Leichhardt sold for $900,000 at auction. Source: Supplied
Where: 35 Elswick St
What: Two-bedroom house
How much: $900,000
Suburb median: $1.121 million
Agent: Elizabeth Casamento, Raine & Horne Montano
The executor selling this crumbling deceased estate kicked off the auction with a vendor bid of $700,000.
It started slowly but the bids went up steadily as three of nine registered buyers went head to head until the hammer fell at $900,000.
The buyer was property developer Adrian Bell who had been looking for a new renovation project.
“This home is so horrible, it’s awesome,” he said.
His plan is to turn the two-bedroom house into a three-bedroom house in six months.
“Our intentions is to make it the best house on the block. We’ll restore the front and at the back we are going to build a single-storey ultra modern house at the back. ” Mr Bell said.
Croydon
Despite a slow auction, 91 Cheltenham Rd, Croydon sold for $1.92 million. Source: Supplied
Where: 91 Cheltenham Rd, Croydon
What: Three-bedroom house
How much: $1.92 million
Suburb median: $1.315 million
Agent: Sam Previtera, Richardson & Wrench Five Dock
Nine buyers registered to bid on this original three-bedroom house which had been on the market for the first time in 45 years.
Bidding opened at $1.6 million with two parties pushing the price up slowly to $1.92 million where the auction stalled for 10 minutes.
After agents Sam Previtera and Rocky Mammone from Richardson & Wrench Five Dock spoke to vendors and buyers, auctioneer Peter Balwin announced that the home was sold.
Executers Joe Falvo and his two sisters were selling the property which had been home to their parents since 1970.
“I was confident because the market is very hot,” Mr Falvo said. “My parents haven’t done much to the house. There’s potential because of the land and the location.”
Agent Sam Previtera from Richardson & Wrench Five Dock said the buyer was a family from Strathfield who were going to build a new home on the 872sq m block.
Cammeray
1B/10 Abbott St, Cammeray sold to an investor for $860,000 Source: Supplied
Where: 1B/10 Abbott St, Cammeray
What: Two-bedroom apartment
How much: $860,000
Suburb median: $1.705 million
Agent: Anthony Godson and Justin Ferguson, Justin Ferguson Property Specialists Cammeray
This two-bedroom apartment in Cammeray set a new record for the complex when it fetched $860,000.
Eight buyers registered to bid at the auction which started at $750,000.
Agent Justin Ferguson from Justin Ferguson Property Specialsits Cammeray said the buyer was a first-home buyer who would rent the property out first and then move in.
“Buyer feedback had been around $800,000 to $830,000,” he said.
Increase
